medihoney-gel.name: Medihoney Gel
medihoney-gel.description: Promotes debridement and reduction of bioburden. Available on unit carts.

hydrogel.name: Hydrogel
hydrogel.description: Adds moisture to dry wounds. Available on unit carts.

iodosorb.name: Iodosorb
iodosorb.description: Absorbs drainage and promotes debridement. Comes from pharmacy.

santyl.name: Santyl
santyl.description: Enzymatic debridement. Apply in nickel-thick layer. Comes from pharmacy.

medihoney-alginate.name: Medihoney Alginate
medihoney-alginate.description: Absorbs drainage and dissolves. Can fill tunnels. Rip or cut to fit. Storeroom (#103872 small, #103873 large).

gelling-fiber.name: Gelling Fiber
gelling-fiber.description: Absorbs drainage and becomes gel. Ribbon for deep tunnels. Storeroom (Aquacel #112580, Exufiber #201580).

hydrofera-blue.name: Hydrofera Blue
hydrofera-blue.description: Blue foam, absorbs drainage. Plain blue side touches wound. Obtain extra from SWAT.

xeroform.name: Xeroform
xeroform.description: Non-adherent, antimicrobial sheets. Useful for skin tears, burns, painful wounds. On unit carts.

prisma-promogran.name: Prisma Promogran
prisma-promogran.description: Dissolvable collagen matrix. Rip or cut to fit, premoisten before applying. Storeroom #135917.

mepilex.name: Mepilex
mepilex.description: Absorbent cover dressing. Variety of sizes. Aggressive adhesive—use caution when removing. Available on unit carts.

tegaderm-absorbent.name: Tegaderm Absorbent
tegaderm-absorbent.description: For shallow wounds—first-line treatment for skin tears. Can be left in place for 1 week. Gentle adhesive. Available on unit carts/Pyxis.

duoderm.name: DuoDerm
duoderm.description: For shallow wounds with minimal exudate. Also comes in Medihoney version (Medihoney HCS storeroom #147573).

abd-gauze.name: ABD & Rolled Gauze
abd-gauze.description: Best for large areas, limbs, or dressings that require frequent changing. Available on unit carts.

collagen.name: Collagen
collagen.indication: Chronic, non-healing wounds or stalled granulation
collagen.description: Stimulates ECM and encourages cellular migration to restart wound healing. Do not use in infected wounds.

silvadene.name: Silvadene
silvadene.indication: Superficial and partial-thickness burns, infected wounds
silvadene.description: Topical antimicrobial. Avoid in patients with sulfa allergy. Apply a thin layer once to twice daily.

betadine.name: Iodasorb / Betadine
betadine.description: Broad-spectrum antiseptic. Promotes eschar formation, prevents MASD. Apply sparingly. Can delay healing if used excessively.

triad-cream.name: Triad Cream
triad-cream.description: Protects periwound and intact skin from moisture damage. Ideal for sacral breakdown. Reapply after each soiling.

mupirocin.name: Mupirocin
mupirocin.description: Topical antibiotic effective against gram-positive bacteria.

gentamicin.name: Gentamicin
gentamicin.description: Topical antibiotic effective against gram-negative bacteria.

zinc-oxide.name: Zinc Oxide
zinc-oxide.description: Protective barrier cream for moisture-prone areas.

calmoseptine.name: Calmoseptine
calmoseptine.description: Moisture barrier and antiseptic for irritated skin.

ad-ointment.name: A&D Ointment
ad-ointment.indication: Minor skin irritation, early skin breakdown
ad-ointment.description: Vitamin-enriched ointment for minor skin protection.

desitin.name: Desitin
desitin.description: Zinc oxide-based barrier cream for diaper rash and moisture protection.

aquaphor.name: Aquaphor
aquaphor.indication: Dry skin, friction areas, minor wounds
aquaphor.description: Occlusive healing ointment for dry and damaged skin.

vaseline.name: Vaseline
vaseline.description: Pure petroleum jelly for occlusive moisture barrier.

silvasorb.name: Silvasorb
silvasorb.indication: Dry or desiccated wounds, superficial burns
silvasorb.description: Silver-impregnated gauze. Maintains moist wound bed, promotes autolytic debridement. Avoid in infected wounds.

coloplast.name: Coloplast
coloplast.description: Collagen sheets/particles to stimulate wound healing.

alginates-silver.name: Alginates/Silver & Calcium/Supersorb
alginates-silver.description: Silver AG is antimicrobial. Helps with draining/bleeding wounds. Comes in sheets, strips, fluff, and rope.

aquacel-ag.name: Aquacel Ag/Opticel
aquacel-ag.description: Converts exudate into gel, promoting moist healing. Requires secondary dressing. Not ideal for dry wounds.

adaptic.name: Adaptic/Telfa Oil Emulsions
adaptic.indication: Fragile skin, graft sites, skin tears
adaptic.description: Nonadherent contact layer. Use when minimizing trauma during dressing changes is important. Apply over ointments if needed.

telfa-pads.name: Telfa Pads
telfa-pads.description: Nonstick surface for moist, superficial wounds. Often paired with secondary gauze wrap.

abd-pads.name: ABD Pads
abd-pads.description: Layer of absorption. Not a primary dressing. Used over packing or as pressure padding.

kerlix-wrap.name: Kerlix Wrap
kerlix-wrap.description: Stretch gauze; allows breathable coverage. Can be used with saline as wet-to-dry dressing base.

coban-ace.name: Coban/ACE
coban-ace.description: Apply with caution; can impair circulation if wrapped too tightly. Use for edema or venous ulcers.

netting-stockinette.name: Netting/Stockinette
netting-stockinette.indication: Dressings on limbs or mobile areas
netting-stockinette.description: Elastic material that allows easy visual inspection of the wound while holding dressing in place.

foam-silicone.name: Foam/Silicone Bordered
foam-silicone.description: Cushions & absorbs moderate drainage, water resistant outside.

island-dressing.name: Bordered Gauze/Island Dressing
island-dressing.description: An adhesive edge with a nonadherent center to help hold the primary dressing in place and keep medications on.
